thread.title: Feminist protesters storm red carpet of Suffragette film
thread.title_full: Feminist protesters storm red carpet of Suffragette film | London - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Feminist protesters storm red carpet of Suffragette film
text:
Feminist protesters from Sisters Uncut stormed the red carpet of the premiere of the film Suffragette in Leicester Square last night.
The were chaotic scenes as women ran on to the red carpet, and lay on the floor making a human chain as the stars of the film were due to walk down.
The group are a direct action group formed to fight against the cuts to domestic violence services and the disproportionate impact of the government's austerity measures against women.
Sisters Uncut @SistersUncut Follow Here are our flyers from tonight. #deadwomencantvote http://t.co/8DCutvkapr
22:04 - 7 Oct 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite The demonstrators chanted "dead women can't vote", and some of the protesters carried posters that said "two women killed every week". Others held banners with the words "50/50 Parliament", calling for equality in the British government.
Play video The new film, which tells the story of the British women's suffrage movement of the late 19th and early 20th century, stars Carey Mulligan, Meryl Streep and Anne-Marie Duff.
Helena Bonham Carter, who also stars in the film, applauded the protesters.
I think it's marvellous. That is exactly what the suffragettes were about. Hopefully the film will inspire anybody who feels an injustice has been done, to be bold enough to protest.
â€“ Helena Bonham Carter Last updated Thu 8 Oct 2015 Entertainment
